meanings.definition: To make something into a commercial product or service for sale.
meanings.sent1: The company commercialises their new invention to sell it in stores.
meanings.sent2: She commercialises her artwork by selling prints online.
meanings.sent3: The chef commercialises his secret recipe by offering cooking classes.
meanings.sent4: The author commercialises her stories by turning them into bestselling books.
meanings.sent5: The farmer commercialises his crops by selling them at the local market.

meanings.sent1: Some companies commercialise the environment for their own gain.
meanings.sent2: He commercialises the talents of young artists for his benefit.
meanings.sent3: The magician commercialises his tricks by performing at birthday parties.
meanings.sent4: The politician commercialises people's fears to advance his agenda.
meanings.sent5: The salesman commercialises the needs of his customers to make a sale.
